item.description:
Myles Standish State Forest may be naturally pretty but the park needs some TLC from time to time. This is our day to help out on some projects that are important to all of us.  Last year, more than 3000 people helped out in parks all over the state.

Please arrive around 9:30 AM to sign in and enjoy coffee and donuts with the park staff and other Friends.  Myles Standish State Forest Supervisor John Roberts will welcome us and explain the projects we will be doing.

We'll split into two groups--One group will work at the Charge Pond equestrian camping area and trails.

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

The other group will work at the "Bentley Loop", the 3.8 mile trail that begins at Parking Lot 2 on Upper College Pond Road.  We'll be trimming back trails, improving trail signage and doing general maintenance.

Volunteers are encouraged to bring their own tools as the state has a limited supply to lend out. Please mark all tools for easy identification. All ages are welcome.

The Friends of Myles Standish SF will supply water and snacks and will also host a BBQ lunch for all volunteers and staff at the Headquarters Amphitheater around 1:15 PM.

Anyone arriving after 10 AM should go straight to the work areas. Be sure to sign in at park headquarters to receive your lunch ticket. Please also sign up at the DCR Park Serve Day web page ( link goes to http://parkserv.env.state.ma.us/ ) in addition to signing up here.

We look forward to seeing you out there!

group.name: Friends of Myles Standish State Forest Meetup Group

item.name: Park Serve Day-- New signs for the Bentley Loop & equestrian campground work
